body.p:
Bedford Trimble co Ky
Oct 19th 1863 --
Dear Sir
I take the liberty to enclose to you for my friends two Petitions, The one of Thos McIntosh is for an old man 70 years of age do pardon him!!!
The other is a poor young man as represented,

I was one of your supporters throughout the election, have stood up to the Union, in Rebellious Trimble and never have nor never will swerve from that good cause, I beg leave to refer you to judge Drane J. L. Scott prosecuting attorney and Saml E. De haven representative from Oldham, & Col Buckley,
The fine in both cases are small, and the bearer Mr W. F. Peek is well acquainted with them and is or will be our clerk any representations he makes I will vouch for

His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlette
Govenor of Ky
Petitions for Remissions see Scott atty for Comlth
